title: The 'cult of Woodford': why do these investors still believe in the failed fund manager?
text:
Investors have flocked to defend Neil Woodford despite the catastrophic collapse of his fund house and portfolios over the past few days.

Once renowned as Britain’s best stock-picker, Mr Woodford’s Equity Income fund was wound up by Link, the investment administrators, on Monday, with his other funds quickly following.

Savers who owned it told Telegraph Money they were furious their money had been locked in and would now be stuck until January at the earliest, but not all investors are as frustrated.

Mr Woodford managed more than £30bn at Invesco Perpetual, but quit in 2014 to go it alone, quickly racking up a record £1.6bn in money for his new fund as investors followed him.
